intro: Erigeron flabellifolius, commonly known as the broad-leaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and prairies. It features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically white or pale blue. Erigeron flabellifolius is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
